div1.head: ANALYTICAL INDEX TO THE LAWS OF TEXAS FROM 1823 TO 1905.
div1.p:
ABATEMENT (see Pleading and Prac-
tice for all acts regulating practice in courts; see the several courts for acts relating solely to them.)—
Suits not to abate on death of party thereto, etc., 1-1516-1838.

No plea in abatement shall be admit-
ted or received unless the party of-
fering the same shall prove the truth thereof by oath or affirmation, as the case may require, 2-263-1840.
Plaintiff to recover full costs to time of overruling plea, 2-266-1840.

Causes pending in Supreme Court, or therafter taken to Supreme Court, on appeal, or writ of error, or after filing of appeal bond or service of writ of error, not to abate on death of party to record, but judgment be rendered, 7-53-1871.
